repnme.cdata!:
Jordan - Second Human Resources Sector
            Investment Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Human Resources Development
            Sector Investment Project for Jordan had a satisfactory
            outcome with likely sustainability, substantial
            institutional development impact, and satisfactory
            performances by both the Bank and Borrower.  The project was
            extended three times during implementation as a result of
            delayed project implementation and delays in the
            construction of civil works and the procurement of
            equipment.  Both the Gulf War of 1991 and frequent changes
            of Ministry of Education (MOE) officials affected project
            implementation and outcome.  The project provides the
            following key lessons: (i) Greater care to design a
            comprehensive evaluation program prior to the acceptance of
            school buildings and other works by the responsible
            ministry. (ii) Complex projects must have clear and
            measurable objectives, and an effective monitoring and
            evaluation system prior to project effectiveness. (iii)
            Projects with a substantial capital construction component
            must include a comprehensive component or sub-component to
            addresses maintenance. (iv) Effective monitoring and
            evaluation is fundamental for a complex project and projects
            should consider contracting out this function with both
            qualitative and quantitative indicators. (v) The project
            director must be responsible for all implementation issues
            have adequate time for project implementation matters,
            while more complex projects should have a project director
            in each ministry. (vi) A two tier institutional structure
            can provide intellectual rigor and independent oversight
            apart from more traditional oversight agencies. (vii) Future
            school building projects should involve local participation
            in deciding new building location and design, with emphasis
            on the construction of low maintenance buildings in existing
            schools. (viii) High caliber technical assistance is
            critical for an effective training program. (ix) Ensure
            trainers are competent and adequate materials are available.
            Also ensure that: the environment and timing is conducive to
            effective learning; there is a suitable incentive system;
            and there is an effective and ongoing monitoring and
            evaluation program.

repnme.cdata!:
Jordan - Second Human Resources Development
            Sector Investment Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The central objective of the Human
            Resource Development Sector Investment Loan Project is to
            improve educational quality. The focus will be on measures
            to enhance the teaching-learning environment including
            teaching competencies, curricula and textbooks,
            administration and management, and creating a strong
            institutional framework particularly in relation to
            vocational and technical education, examinations and
            national assessment. In addition, measures will be sought
            aimed at economizing in the use of public resources.
